heading: Learn about online check ins for people on probation
whatsNew: About online check ins

Online check ins allow people on probation to submit a short video to check their identity, and answer 3 questions to tell practitioners how they are. This can be used to replace some face-to-face appointments where appropriate, or used alongside face-to-face appointments to help manage risk.
Help with using online check ins
You can get familiar with online check ins using our guidance (opens in new tab).
Bug fixes for Manage people on probation

To help you arrange appointments faster, we’ve improved page loading speed. Thanks to the users who reported this was slowing them down.

To make it easier for you to upload files, we’ve made some technical changes so that you can add one file at a time to an appointment outcome.

You can now arrange planned telephone contacts (NS) without needing to select a location. This fixes a bug that was causing errors.

heading: View alerts and get calendar invitations for appointments
whatsNew: Get calendar invitations for appointments with people on probation

To make managing your appointment schedule easier, you now get an automatic meeting invitation in your inbox when you arrange an appointment with a person on probation.  The invitation appears as private in your calendar, so only you will see the appointment details which include: 
the title 
the time and date
a direct link to the appointment within the service  
If you arrange an appointment for someone else, they will get the private meeting invitation instead.
Type your appointment start and end times

To make it easier for you to add accurate appointment start and end times, you can now type the times you need, using the format hh:mm. 

Thanks to the users who said this would be quicker than selecting from a list.
Arrange past appointments

You can now arrange appointments in the past if they have an attended and complied outcome. 
Use NDelius if you need to arrange past appointments with other outcomes.

heading: View all outcomes to log on one page and other service improvements
whatsNew: View all outcomes to log on one page
The ‘You need to record an outcome for xx appointments’ link now goes to a page that lists every appointment without an outcome, so you can view them quicker.
Manage appointments in this service
You can use Manage people on probation (MPOP) to manage appointments arranged in this service, with a bug fix stopping those links from going to NDelius.
Thanks to our users at Harrow and Barnet PDU for this feedback. If you have any ideas or comments, we’d love to hear via mpop-digital-team@justice.gov.uk.
NDelius Risk flags
The risk flags now display the same data as on NDelius, correcting a bug where risk showed as ‘high’ instead of ‘medium’ for ‘risk to staff’.
Adding and viewing notes
To save you a click, you can now add notes right after selecting that a person on probation attended and complied. This change means you do not return to the appointment details before adding notes.
You can now read a long note in a dedicated page, thanks to a bug fix.
Clearer signposting between NDelius and MPOP

We’ve made it easier for you to see which service an appointment was created on. NDelius-created appointments now display ‘Manage on NDelius’ links on the ‘Appointments’ page, and on the ‘Activity log’ page for appointments without outcomes.
